text: The Antonov An-22 (Ukrainian: Антонов Ан-22; NATO reporting name: Cock) is a Ukrainian cargo aircraft. It was used both by civilian and military operators. It's first flight was in 1965. The Soviet airline Aeroflot started using it in 1967. For military duties it was replaced by the An-124. Category:Soviet & Russian aircraft Category:Civil aircraft Category:Soviet military aircraft
title: Antonov An-22
